questiontext.text: A student who is taking a block course gets an assignment to write a paper on a certain topic. Material for the writing must be obtained from reliable sources. Therefore, he had to find the source of information needed for writing. He hopes that he can find complete, easily accessible, and fast sources of information. Through a search engine, he wants to find information about cavities or carious teeth. For the above purposes, then he should search using symbols?

answer.text: NOT
OR
WITH
AND

questiontext.text: FKG Unhas new students are learning to develop case-based learning methods. What is not in accordance with the characteristics of the learning method above?

answer.text: Less challenging
Development of attitudes and behavior
Understanding of the rules
Improve cognitive abilities
Psychomotor and affective in the form of mastery of science

questiontext.text: A student temporarily compiles his scientific paper, and to get the latest data or input the student then looks for scientific references on the internet. He then got an article that reviewed several articles. What types of scientific articles are you referring to?

answer.text: Letters to the editor
Short communication
Proceeding
Research articles
Review article

Experience

questiontext.text: In an article listed "keywords: alginate, white glutinous rice starch, dimensional stability". What is the right amount of keyword writing in the scenario?

Keywords need not appear in the title
should be listed alphabetically
Keywords are not mandatory
The keyword dimensional stability should be the two keywords

questiontext.text: The mind mapping step is considered a method capable of supporting the application of the seven jumps method. Mention positive things from mind mapping that can support the implementation of the seven jumps?

Mind mapping provides an opportunity to analyze a broad range of problems
Mind Mapping takes a long time to figure out
Mind mapping prioritizes memorization
Mind mapping needs solitude

questiontext.text: Writing the correct "Medical Index" is?

answer.text: Drake L, Baumgartner JC, The Chemical Reaction of Irrigations Used for Root canal Irrigation Regiment, Inter J Endod. 2003; 12 (13): 47-51.

Grande N.M. Plotino G, Pecci. Bedini, Malagnino & Somma F. Cyclic fatigue resistance and three-dimensional analysis of instruments from two nickel-titanium rotary systems. International Endodontic Journal, 39, 755Ð763, 2006
Philips, R. W. (1991). Skinner's Science of Dental Materials. ed. 9. Indianapolis: WB Saunders. pp. 455-472

questiontext.text: If a student makes a scientific paper and the references cited are written first in a footnote. The correct writing systematics is?

answer.text: Author name reversed, title underlined, including page number, year of publication, and name of the publisher
Author name reversed and abbreviated, underlined title, including page number, year of publication, and name of the publisher
Author name is written in full, not reversed, the title is underlined, includes the page number, year of publication, and name of the publisher
Author name is not reversed, abbreviated title is underlined, includes the page number, year of publication, and the name of the publisher
Author name is written in full without title, title is underlined, includes the page number, year of publication, and name of the publisher

What are the results/outputs from the fifth step in the seven jumps method tutorial process?

answer.text: An important question
Various references
Answers to unfamiliar terms
Group learning objectives
Collection of temporary answers

The Ogive Line

Long time in determining important questions
References belonging to the group are quite diverse
The concepts in the scenario are well understood by group members
Tutors facilitate discussion well

Change fonts so as not to be monotonous

questiontext.text: One of the requirements for making a table that presents the results of a study in scientific writing, namely?

answer.text: The table number must be continuous from the start
The table should display the vertical lines
The table shall display horizontal lines only on the head and cover of the table
The word table is written in capital letters
The title of the table is written clearly under the table

questiontext.text: In terms of color selection for presentations with PowerPoint

answer.text: Bright colors are more contrasting and easy to read in 1 second
Layout must match the text color
Red color against blue / dark background makes the text difficult to read
uses a font color that is contrasting than the background-color: red with white
use variegated colors

questiontext.text: In a scientific paper, the requirements for writing numbers are?

answer.text: A number one digit or more at the beginning of the sentence, the name of the number is written
Single-digit numbers without units are written with numbers
One-digit number with the unit written the name of the number
The one-digit number at the beginning of the sentence is written with the numbers in parentheses
Numbers two digits or more at the beginning of the sentence are written with numbers

questiontext.text: Only a few clinical studies have evaluated the response of pulp tissue to intrusion pressure in humans.4-8 Sabuncuoglu and Ersahan, 4 Ikawa et al, 5 and Sano et al6 describe a significant reduction in PBF caused by intrusion pressure, whereas Barwick and Ramsay7 found no change. on PBF during the intrusion. From several studies conducted on humans, most of what was studied was the application of intrusion pressure to the incisors, whereas only one study was in molars. What does the scenario above show?

answer.text: citation number "8" at the end of the illustration indicates that all statements in the illustration come from citation number 8
Sabuncuoglu and Ersahan, 4 Ikawa et al, 5 and Sano et al. 6 explain that ÉÉÉ etc. point out that only Sano et al. were the source of this statement
Sano et al6 means Sano and friends whose source is from bibliography number 6
Sabuncuoglu and Ersahan, 4 means that the two names came from different articles
Citation numbers 4-8, should be 4, 5, 6, 7, 8

questiontext.text: The tutorial group of FKG Unhas students was carrying out a discussion in the first tutorial, the group leader invited one of the students to read the scenario. After reading the scenario, the group leader invited the group members to identify the unfamiliar term, one of the students mentioned one of the terminologies that was not understood and not a single student was able to explain the explanation related to the terminology. What should the group leader do with this terminology?

answer.text: Proceed to the stage of identifying problems / creating questions
Enter the terminology to be discussed at the brainstorming stage
Ask a tutor to explain the terminology
Proceed to the keyword identification stage
Enter the terminology into learning objectives

questiontext.text: In the tutorial discussion process, it was seen that a student was very dominant in answering every question. This became the focus of the facilitator in the group. Before this stage/step ends, the facilitator recalls the group's agreement on whether the answers submitted are correct or not. What stage is the process in the example above?

answer.text: Independent study
Determining learning objectives
Problem analysis
Clarify unfamiliar terminology
Determine questions

questiontext.text: In a scientific paper, in the footnote section, found the term Ibid. What does this term mean?

answer.text: The references cited are sourced from the same source and page as the previous references
The references cited come from the same source but on a different page than the previous references that have been interspersed with other references
The references cited are sourced from the same source and page as the previous references which have been interspersed with other references
The references cited are sourced from the same source and page as the two previous references which have been interspersed with other references
The references cited come from the same source but on a different page than the previous reference

questiontext.text: PBL is developed based on modern cognitive psychology theory which states that learning is a learning process that actively constructs knowledge through its interaction with a learning environment designed by the learning facilitator. The theory developed contains the principle?

answer.text: Learning is a construction process not an accepting process
New information obtained from independent learning
Learning is not influenced by social interaction factors and the contextual nature of the lesson.
Problems become a focus and are a means of developing problem-solving skills
The lecturer acts as a facilitator and moderator

Facilitating group participation

questiontext.text: The tutorial group of FKG Unhas students is carrying out a discussion in the first tutorial, students have identified the problem by making questions, then the chairman asks for approval to proceed to the next stage. questiontext.text: The tutorial group of FKG Unhas students is carrying out a discussion in the second tutorial, the tutor asks students to report their independent study results related to the explanation of learning objectives from the results of independent learning. Ask another member to add an explanation regarding these learning objectives
Ask other group members to continue discussing the next learning objective
The head of the group adds an explanation regarding these learning objectives
Ask all other group members to report an explanation of each learning objective
